item.title: Ashley add a quote by D.H. Lawrence
item.description: "For my part, I prefer my heart to be broken. It is so lovely, dawn-kaleidoscopic within the crack." -- D.H. Lawrence

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Maurice Sendak
item.description: "I'll eat you up I love you so." -- Maurice Sendak

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "No tears in the writer, no tears in the reader. No surprise in the writer, no surprise in the reader." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "Those who dream by day are cognizant of many things which escape those who dream only by night." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Stuff your eyes with wonder, he said, live as if you'd drop dead in ten seconds. See the world. It's more fantastic than any dream made or paid for in factories." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Ashley add a quote by W.B. Yeats
item.description: "What can be explained is not poetry." -- W.B. Yeats

item.title: Ashley add a quote by William Butler Yeats
item.description: "There is another world, but it is in this one." -- William Butler Yeats

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "You have to write the book that wants to be written. And if the book will be too difficult for grown-ups, then you write it for children." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Lock up your libraries if you like; but there is no gate, no lock, no bolt that you can set upon the freedom of my mind." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "And by the way, everything in life is writable about if you have the outgoing guts to do it, and the imagination to improvise. The worst enemy to creativity is self-doubt." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "One day I will find the right words, and they will be simple." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You must stay drunk on writing so reality cannot destroy you." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Fiction is the truth inside the lie." -- Stephen King

item.title: Ashley add a quote by William Butler Yeats
item.description: "Had I the heavens' embroidered cloths, Enwrought with golden and silver light, The blue and the dim and the dark cloths Of night and light and the half light, I would spread the cloths under your feet: But I, being poor, have only my dreams; I have spread my dreams under your feet; Tread softly because you tread on my dreams." -- William Butler Yeats

item.title: Ashley add a quote by William Butler Yeats
item.description: "Out of the quarrel with others we make rhetoric; out of the quarrel with ourselves we make poetry." -- William Butler Yeats

item.title: Ashley add a quote by William Butler Yeats
item.description: "Hope and Memory have one daughter and her name is Art, and she has built her dwelling far from the desperate field where men hang out their garments upon forked boughs to be banners of battle. O beloved daughter of Hope and Memory, be with me for a while." -- William Butler Yeats

item.title: Ashley add a quote by William Butler Yeats
item.description: "We taste and feel and see the truth. We do not reason ourselves into it." -- William Butler Yeats

item.title: Ashley add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Things are sweeter when they're lost. I know--because once I wanted something and got it. It was the only thing I ever wanted badly, Dot, and when I got it it turned to dust in my hand." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The two most important days in your life are the day you are born and the day you find out why." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Ashley add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "If you cannot get rid of the family skeleton, you may as well make it dance." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I talk to God but the sky is empty." -- Sylvia Plath
